title: Jharkhand coal mine collapse kills 4 workers: Bridge collapsed in Narsinghpur, MP; 75 people died so far du... - Bhaskar English
article_text:
English News

National

Flash Flood In Mandi, Himachal Pradesh Leaves 31 Missing; Heavy Rain Swells Dharhali, Saktoh Rivers In J&K

Monsoon 2025 Jharkhand coal mine collapse kills 4 workers: Bridge collapsed in Narsinghpur, MP; 75 people died so far due to floods, landslides in Himachal

2 minutes ago



Copy link

Jharkhand witnessed relentless rain on Saturday, leading to the collapse of an illegal coal mine in Mahua Tangri, Ramgarh district. Four workers lost their lives and four others were injured.

The state remains under an orange alert for heavy rainfall until Monday morning. Whereas, Madhya Pradesh, continuous downpours have caused flooding in several areas.

The Narmada River is overflowing in Mandla district, and a key bridge on the national highway between Narsinghpur and Hoshangabad has collapsed.

Himachal Pradesh has recorded 75 deaths and 288 injuries

Himachal Pradesh has recorded 75 deaths and 288 injuries

Himachal Pradesh has recorded 75 deaths and 288 injuries due to flood and landslide incidents since the monsoon arrived on June 20.

Mandi district alone reported 14 deaths from cloudbursts and 31 people remain missing. A red alert for heavy rain is still in effect.

.

India Weather Today Live Updates: Water level in the Dharhali and Saktoh rivers rises after heavy rainfall in J&K

Heavy rainfall Sunday caused the rise of water levels in the Dharhali and Saktoh rivers in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri district, news agency ANI reported.

Similar weather conditions in Srinagar have brought respite from heat as well, as per ANI.

title: Haryana Rain Alert: हरियाणा में अगले 3 घंटों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, पहली बार रेड अलर्ट जारी - Best24News
article_text:
Home/BREAKING NEWS/Haryana Rain Alert: हरियाणा में अगले 3 घंटों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, पहली बार रेड अलर्ट जारी
BREAKING NEWSHARYANA
Haryana Rain Alert: हरियाणा में अगले 3 घंटों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, पहली बार रेड अलर्ट जारी
Haryana Rain Alert: हरियाणा में पहली बार मौसम विभाग ने बारिश का रेड अलर्ट जारी किया है। मौसम विभाग ने 3 जिलों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी दी है
 Best24News 
Send an email
2 hours agoLast Updated: July 6, 2025
 1,190हरियाणा नौकरियां
 Share
Facebook
 
X
 
LinkedIn

Haryana Rain Alert: हरियाणा में पहली बार मौसम विभाग ने बारिश का रेड अलर्ट जारी किया है। मौसम विभाग ने 3 जिलों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी दी है। इनमें पंचकूला,अंबाला और यमुनानगर शामिल है। अगले 3 घंटे में यहां बारिश की संभावना जताई है।

इसके साथ ही यमुनानगर, अंबाला और पंचकूला के कुछ हिस्सों में बारिश का ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। यहां पर हल्की से मध्यम बारिश की संभावना है। जबकि यमुनानगर, अंबाला, कुरुक्षेत्र, कैथल, करनाल और पानीपत के कुछ हिस्सों में बारिश का येलो अलर्ट जारी किया है।

Haryana News: हरियाणा में ग्रुप C के 8500 से ज्यादा पदों पर भर्ती रद्द, नोटिफिकेशन जारी

मौसम विभाग ने आज हरियाणा के 6 जिलो में बारिश का ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया है। इनमें करनाल, कैथल, अंबाला, पंचकूला और यमुनानगर शामिल है। 10 जुलाई तक राज्य में तेज बारिश की संभावना जताई गई है।

 

Haryana News: हरियाणा के CM सैनी के लिए पैदल बुग्गी चलाकर गंगाजल लाएगा जींद का पहलवान, महाशिवरात्रि पर करेंगे अर्पित

title: Texas Flood Video: भारी बारिश के बीच बाढ़ का कहर.. 15 बच्चों समेत 40 से ज्यादा की मौत, लापता लोगों के रेस्क्यू में जुटी टीम - IBC24 News
article_text:
Texas Flood Video| Image Credit: IBC24

Texas Flood Video: टेक्सास। अमेरिका के टेक्सास में शुक्रवार तड़के आई अचानक बाढ़ में कम से कम 51 लोगों की मौत हो गई, जबकि एक ‘समर कैंप’ में शामिल हुई 27 लड़कियां अब भी लापता हैं। केर काउंटी में बाढ़ के कारण 15 बच्चों सहित कम से कम 43 लोगों की मौत हुई तो वहीं आसपास की क्षेत्रों में भी कई लोग मारे गए।

45 मिनट में 26 फुट बढ़ा जलस्तर

ग्वाडालूप नदी का जलस्तर 45 मिनट में 26 फुट बढ़ गया, पेड़ उखड़ गए, वाहन बह गए और कई इमारतें क्षतिग्रस्त हो गईं। बाढ़ के लिहाज से संवेदनशील इलाकों में वर्षों से ‘समर कैंप’ आयोजित किए जाते हैं जहां प्रतिवर्ष हजारों बच्चे आते हैं। हंट इलाके में ग्वाडालूप नदी किनारे के ‘मिस्टिक कैंप’ की 27 लड़कियां लापता हैं।

नहीं दी गई चेतावनी

Texas Flood Video: बचाव अभियान में हेलीकॉप्टर, नाव और ड्रोन की मदद ली जा रही है और अब तक 850 से अधिक लोगों को बचाया गया है। गवर्नर ग्रेग एबॉट ने कहा कि अधिकारी राहत एवं बचाव कार्य चौबीसों घंटे जारी रखेंगे। स्थानीय लोगों का आरोप है कि प्रशासन ने बाढ़ आने की कोई पूर्व चेतावनी नहीं दी।

और पढ़ें

title: Heavy Rain Alert! Monsoon Intensifies Over Odisha, IMD Issues Warnings for 19 Districts - Pragativadi
article_text:
The southwest monsoon remains active across Odisha, prompting the India Meteorological Department (IMD) to issue heavy rainfall warnings for 19 districts, including orange alerts for Keonjhar and Mayurbhanj, where very heavy to extremely heavy downpours are expected.

As of Saturday, widespread rainfall has been reported throughout the state, and conditions are likely to persist on Sunday, with thunderstorms and gusty winds (30–40 km/h) forecast across multiple regions.

While Keonjhar and Mayurbhanj face the highest alert level due to already saturated ground and risks of waterlogging and flash floods, 17 other districts are under yellow warnings for moderate rainfall and lightning.

The IMD attributed the weather pattern to a deep monsoon trough and added that a low-pressure system is likely to form over Gangetic West Bengal and nearby areas within the next 12 hours. If it intensifies, eastern and coastal Odisha may experience prolonged rains and stronger winds early next week.

Authorities have urged residents—especially those in low-lying and flood-prone areas—to stay alert and follow local advisories to ensure safety.

title: Heavy rain triggers flood-like situation in Jharsuguda’s Laikera panchayat - Odisha TV
article_text:
Incessant rainfall over the past few days has triggered a flood-like situation in several villages under Laikera Panchayat in Jharsuguda district. The overflowing Hatia River has entered low-lying areas near Rengalbeda and Agria Pada, submerging homes and disrupting normal life.

According to sources, floodwaters entered multiple houses, with water levels reaching ankle to knee-deep inside homes. In many places, the force of the water has damaged doors and entryways, leaving families distressed and vulnerable.

In Rengalbeda village, the floodwater is flowing at a height of nearly 2.5 feet over the roads, cutting off access to several areas. Meanwhile, panic gripped the residents of low-lying settlements, forcing many to flee to safer, higher grounds.

The situation remains tense, with villagers calling for urgent relief and evacuation measures. While no casualties have been reported so far, locals are facing acute difficulties in accessing food, clean water, and medical assistance.

“We had no idea the flood was coming. All our belongings are underwater, and my house has been damaged. I don’t even know where I’ll keep my livestock now,” said a flood-affected resident.

Echoing the same concerns, another resident said, “The relentless rain has devastated our village. We’ve never witnessed anything like this before. In fear, many villagers have fled to safer places.”

other_info.csv_title: Heavy rain triggers flood-like situation in Jharsuguda’s Laikera panchayat - Odisha TV

title: Hirakud Dam Releases Season’s First Flood Water Due To Heavy Rainfall - Ommcom News
article_text:
Bhubaneswar: The authorities of Hirakud Dam in Sambalpur district have released excess water of the season from the reservoir due to heavy rainfall and rising water levels from inflow from the upper catchment. As of 9:00 AM today, the water level at the reservoir stood at 609.45 feet.

After customary worship, the authorities opened Sluice gate number 7 to release the excess water, and a total of 12 sluice gates – eight on the left and four on the right – will be opened in phases to discharge the season’s first floodwater from the dam.

The dam authorities took this precautionary step after closely monitoring the water levels, which have been steadily rising due to upstream rainfall. Villages in the lower catchment of the Hirakud dam have been alerted regarding the rise in water level following the opening of the dam gates.

The authorities have warned that more gates may be opened if rainfall continues and the inflow into the reservoir increases further, in order to manage the dam’s storage capacity.

other_info.csv_title: Hirakud Dam Releases Season’s First Flood Water Due To Heavy Rainfall - Ommcom News
other_info.csv_summary: Hirakud Dam Releases Season’s First Flood Water Due To Heavy Rainfall  Ommcom News

title: IMD sounds yellow alert in Kannur, Kasaragod; warns of sea turbulence and erosion - Onmanorama
article_text:
PUBLISHED: JULY 06 , 2025 08:20 AM IST
As monsoon rains continue to lash across central and northern Kerala, with the India Meteorological Department (IMD) issuing a yellow alert for Kannur and Kasaragod districts for Sunday and July 9.
The IMD has also warned of high waves and coastal erosion along the shores of Kannur and Kasaragod until 8.30 pm on Monday. Wave heights are expected to range between 2.9 and 3.1 metres. Isolated areas may experience strong winds reaching speeds of 40 to 50 km/h on both days.
Fishing activities remain permitted along the Kerala coast on Sunday, as no restrictions have been issued.

title: Toll rises to 43 in Texas flash floods, 15 children among dead - Kerala Kaumudi
article_text:
WASHINGTON: The death toll from the flash floods following heavy rains in Texas, US, rose to 43. 15 children are among the dead. 27 girls who had come to attend a summer camp along the Guadalupe River went missing in the floods. The heavy flooding occurred in the northwest area of San Antonio, Texas. Authorities said more than 850 people have been rescued.

1/1 Skip Ad Continue watching after the ad Visit Advertiser website GO TO PAGE



The Guadalupe River in Kerr County, Texas, rose to 29 feet in just one hour after heavy rain. Authorities have intensified the search for the missing. About a thousand people have been evacuated from the area. Meantime, local authorities said that there was no flood warning in the area.



Videos of several houses and trees being swept away by the floodwaters following the flash floods are already circulating on social media. Authorities warn that more damage is possible as the rain is expected to intensify in the coming days. US media reported that trucks had begun arriving at the camp site on Friday evening to evacuate people. Officials said the death toll could rise. The bodies of 12 adults and five children have to be identified, officials said.

Admin speeds up flood relief work in Balasore
The Hans India
Hans News Service | 6 July 2025 7:30 AM IST
HIGHLIGHTS
Bhubaneswar: The Odisha government on Friday said there was no flood threat in the State as the water levels in all the major rivers, including Suba...

Bhubaneswar: The Odisha government on Friday said there was no flood threat in the State as the water levels in all the major rivers, including Suba rnarekha, in the northern part of the State receded. The administration of Balasore district, which had witnessed widespread inundation due to heavy rain and the release of water from neighbouring Jharkhand, intensified relief work as floodwater got drained out from most villages, officials said.

“As the situation has improved a lot with the receding of water, we have intensified relief work. Now, we can reach all places and carry out relief activities,” a Balasore district official said. At least two persons died and over 100 villages in Balasore remained under floodwater, with the Subarnarekha, Budhabalanga and Jalaka rivers breaching embankments. At least 50,000 people in seven blocks were affected by the deluge.

“Now, there is no flood threat in the State. Everywhere, rivers are flowing below the danger level,” Water Resources department engineer-in-chief Chandrasekhar Padhi said. He said Subarnarekha river was flowing 2.27 metres below the danger level in Rajghat. The Mahanadi river was at 4 metres below the danger level in Naraj, the Brahmani at 3.75 metres below the threshold at Jenapur and the Baitarani at 1.16 metres below such a limit at Akhuapada.

There was no heavy rain in the State in the last 24 hours, barring one or two places, another official said. Sundargarh district and neighbouring Chhattisgarh experienced isolated rainfalls.

However, the State government has asked the district administrations to remain alert to address any sudden weather changes.

title: Texas flooding: What is religious significance of Camp Mystic where Guadalupe River flood waters kill many - The Economic Times
article_text:
Texas flooding: What is religious significance of Camp Mystic where Guadalupe River flood waters kill many girls? Check rare facts
NYT News Service
The flooded Guadalupe River in Hunt, Texas, near the site of Camp Mystic. (New York Times)

Synopsis

Camp Mystic has a reported religious connection. It is located on the banks of the beautiful Guadalupe River.
By Global Desk
Follow us
Jul 06, 2025, 12:30:00 AM IST
Tragedy struck Camp Mystic where raging floodwaters swept away dozens of girls killing several and leaving many others missing. The camp was founded by a University of Texas football coach. It was established along the banks of the Guadalupe River in central Texas hill country nearly a century ago "to provide young girls with a wholesome Christian atmosphere." When the flash flood struck early on Friday, it was less than a week into its second four-week term with more than 700 children in residence, according to details provided Friday by Texas Lieutenant Governor Dan Patrick, as per a report.


ADVERTISEMENT
Camp Mystic

Camp Mystic, described on its website as "nestled among cypress, live oak and pecan trees ... on the banks of the beautiful Guadalupe River," operates three sessions each summer, offering classic summer camp activities including archery, canoeing, arts and crafts, horseback riding and a variety of sports, Reuters report.



It says it aims to challenge campers to meet its three ideals: "Be a better person for being at Mystic"; "Let Mystic bring out the best in them"; and "Grow spiritually."

Explore More Stories
Buck Moon 2025: Here’s how to see the July Full Moon — Best viewing time for New York, LA, London & more
Is China gearing up for World War III? New Beijing mega military city with nuclear bunker raises alarms
Millions of Americans use these 2 apps, now they are closing forever, and you might get a payout

‘Dinosaur Egg Grow a Garden’ update: How players can hatch rare pets and cultivate ancient plants
Tropical Storm Chantal makes landfall threat real for Carolinas as heavy rain, rip currents and flooding risks rise across coastal South


The current owners, Dick and Tweety Eastland, are the third generation of the family that bought the camp in 1939, the camp website says.

Camp Mystic, located about 85 miles northwest of San Antonio, has operated nearly continuously since its founding in 1926 by E.J. "Doc" Stewart, who coached the Texas Longhorns football squad from 1923-1926 and, according to a UT historian, is the coach under whom the team first appeared in its iconic burnt orange and white uniforms.


ADVERTISEMENT
Since then, it has operated each summer except for three years during World War Two, when it was leased by the U.S. government as a recovery facility for Army Air Corps veterans, according to the camp's website.


FAQs

Q1. Where is Camp Mystic located?

ADVERTISEMENT
A1. Camp Mystic, located about 85 miles northwest of San Antonio in Texas.

Q2. Who are owners of Camp Mystic?
A2. The current owners, Dick and Tweety Eastland, are the third generation of the family that bought Camp Mystic in 1939, the camp website says.

title: Heavy rains trigger mudslide at KMC dumping site; wall collapse damages vehicles at PHQ Kohima - Eastern Mirror
article_text:
Heavy rainfall triggers mudslide in Jotsoma and wall collapse at PHQ Kohima, damaging vehicles and disrupting traffic.
KOHIMA — Following heavy rainfall on Saturday afternoon, mudslides occurred at the KMC dumping site in Jotsoma, blocking vehicular movement along the route.
According to sources, clearance efforts are currently underway to reopen the road for traffic. In the meantime, all vehicles have been diverted through the Jotsoma bypass road.
In a separate incident, a portion of the retaining wall of the DIG Complex at the Nagaland Police Headquarters (PHQ) in Kohima collapsed at around 2.30 pm on Saturday.
While no casualties were reported, the collapsed wall damaged three vehicles parked along the road. A recovery vehicle from Kohima DEF and a JCB from the Police Department have been deployed to clear the debris, which is expected to be completed by Sunday.
Read more updates: Incessant rainfall triggers widespread flooding in Dimapur and Niuland districts
Wall collapse in Kohima damages vehicles

other_info.csv_title: Heavy rains trigger mudslide at KMC dumping site; wall collapse damages vehicles at PHQ Kohima - Eastern Mirror
other_info.csv_summary: Heavy rains trigger mudslide at KMC dumping site; wall collapse damages vehicles at PHQ Kohima  Eastern Mirror

title: Rain triggers flood, landslide in Niuland - Nagaland Post
article_text:
Incessant rains during night of July 4 and July 5, 2025 caused swelling of rivers and streams which flooded nearby areas.

Downpour resulted in inundation of houses d besides causing extensive damage to paddy fields, fishery ponds, plantations, farms, and roads.

According to DIPR report, more than 70 villages were affected displacing thousands of farmers and severely impacting their livelihoods.It was reported that one of the most affected routes-road connecting S. Hetoyi Village and Ghokuto Village- has been rendered impassable due to a major landslide. A portion of the road has also been washed away, cutting off Ghokuto village.Niuland district administration is closely monitoring the situation and taking necessary steps to assess the damage and provide emergency relief. Rescue and restoration efforts are underway, but continuous rainfall was posing challenge to relief operations.

other_info.csv_title: Rain triggers flood, landslide in Niuland - Nagaland Post
other_info.csv_summary: Rain triggers flood, landslide in Niuland  Nagaland Post

title: 29 जिलों में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट: मिर्जापुर में 6 जगह भूस्खलन, काशी में 1 सेमी प्रतिघंटे बढ़ रही गंगा - Dainik Bhaskar
article_text:
Hindi News

Local

Uttar pradesh

Up Monsoon Live Updates Rain Alert Photo Video Imd Weather Varanasi Lucknow Kanpur Prayagraj Agra

यूपी मानसून LIVE 29 जिलों में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट: मिर्जापुर में 6 जगह भूस्खलन, काशी में 1 सेमी प्रतिघंटे बढ़ रही गंगा

उत्तर प्रदेश 1 घंटे पहले



कॉपी लिंक

तस्वीर मिर्जापुर की है। यहां शनिवार को 6 जगहों पर भूस्खलन हुआ।

यूपी में मानसून जमकर बरस रहा है। आज भी 29 जिलों में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट है। 48 जिलों में बिजली गिरने की चेतावनी है। 24 घंटे में प्रदेश के 56 जिलों मे 6.1 मिमी बारिश हुई। इस सीजन अब तक 142.3 मिमी बारिश हो चुकी है। जो सामान्य से 13% ज्यादा है।

title: Chennai Weather: Light To Moderate Rainfall Is Predicted In Some Regions Of Tamil Nadu; Check More Details - MSN
article_text:
Chennai: The capital city is known as the Gateway to South India, and usually experiences hot and humid weather conditions during the summer and early monsoon months. The Chennai Meteorological Department (IMD)gas predicted a mix of rain and scorching heat across Tamil Nadu over the next few days.
The city's weather is expected to remain warm and humid, with occasional chances of light rainfall due to the ongoing Southwest Monsoon influence. On Friday, the capital city woke up at 05: 47 AM and the sun is likely to set at 6: 39 PM. Today, the minimum and maximum temperatures are likely to be around 28 degrees Celsius and 35 degrees Celsius, respectively. The humidity is expected to be around 70 per cent.
The Regional Meteorological Department (RMC) has predicted rainfall to continue over Tamil Nadu. Other parts of the state will experience light rainfall, which is likely to be accompanied by thunderstorms. The temperatures are expected to remain above normal, causing discomfort in several regions.

Pakistan, June 26 -- Heavy monsoon rains lashed Pakistan's twin cities of Rawalpindi and Islamabad early Wednesday, triggering urban flooding alerts as authorities issued warnings for continued thunderstorms across Punjab and parts of the northwestern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.
The Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) said the current weather system is expected to persist in Islamabad-Rawalpindi and surrounding areas, warning in a statement that "urban flooding may occur. during the forecast period."
The public has been advised to take precautionary measures.
By 6:30am Wednesday, over 80 millimeters of rain had already been recorded across the two cities, according to Rawalpindi's Water and Sanitation (WASA). Specific rainfall totals included 52 mm in Saidpur, 66 mm in Bokra, 53 mm in Pir Wadhai, and 55 mm in Shamsabad, WASA Managing Director Muhammad Saleem Ashraf said.
Ashraf saaid a rain emergency had been declared, with WASA teams deployed alongside heavy machinery in low-lying areas.
"All city drains including Nullah Lai are being monitored. at present, the water flow remains within normal levels," he said, noting the depth of the stream at key points stood at 9 feet at Katarian and 5 feet at Gawalmandi Bridge.

Pakistan, June 29 -- LAHORE - A strong thunderstorm accompanied by heavy rain lashed Lahore and surrounding areas on Sunday, breaking the long spell of humidity and bringing much-needed relief to residents. However, the storm also caused significant power disruptions across the city.
Key areas like Shimla Pahari, Mall Road, Gulberg, Muslim Town, and Allama Iqbal Town were among those hit by the downpour. As winds intensified, 178 LESCO feeders tripped, plunging several neighborhoods into darkness. Crews are working to restore electricity in the affected zones.
In response, the Punjab government has activated its monsoon emergency plan. Chief Minister Maryam Nawaz directed authorities to provide real-time updates on the plan's execution and ensured that District Emergency Operation Centers would remain active around the clock across all districts.
The Provincial Disaster Management Authority (PDMA) has issued detailed safety instructions to help residents stay safe during the monsoon season. Officials have been told to identify weak and hazardous buildings, while people living in dangerous structures have been urged to relocate immediately.
Maryam Nawaz emphasized full preparedness of deputy commissioners, assistant commissioners, and rescue departments. She also appealed to the public to strictly follow government-issued safety guidelines, stressing that protecting lives remains the top priority.
Meanwhile, the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) issued a countrywide alert warning of more heavy rainfall. It also raised concerns about potential flooding in Gilgit-Baltistan due to melting glaciers. Emergency teams nationwide are now on high alert to respond swiftly to any crisis.
Kavrepalanchok, July 4 -- Kavrepalanchok authorities have extended the nighttime ban on passenger and private vehicles on the BP highway for another month amid persistent flood and landslide threats.
The district security committee decided to restrict movement on the highway from 6:30pm to 5am until August first week, Assistant Chief District Officer Sudarshan Shrestha said on Friday.
The decision follows an earlier 15-day ban imposed on June 20 after a joint security coordination meeting involving Kavre, Sindhuli, and Ramechhap districts cited risks posed by monsoon-related floods and landslides.
The highway section between Kavre Bhanjyang and Khurkot has been damaged by heavy rains. Landslides have obstructed roadways and caused soil erosion, officials said.
Repair works are underway but remain incomplete, with several vulnerable points making nighttime travel unsafe, Shrestha added.
The district administration has urged commuters to use the highway only during daylight hours and said it is mobilising resources for full road restoration.
The ban has caused disruptions to transport services but officials maintain it is necessary to ensure public safety.

Dengue cases drop sharply despite onset of monsoon
The Hans India
Hans News Service | 6 July 2025 9:30 AM IST
HIGHLIGHTS
Less than 10 cases have been reported in 19 districts, while remaining districts see 10 cases

Hyderabad: The number of dengue fever cases has declined this year in the State, according to official data. However, there slight increase in cases in the GHMC (Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation) limits.

Health Minister Damodar Raja Narasimha said preventive measures taken by the Health department drew good results.

The Health Minister held a high level review on the spread of communicable and seasonal diseases and preventive measures taken by the department on Saturday. Officials briefed the minister that the number of patients of the seasonal diseases has reduced due to strict preventive measures.

Compared to last year, the officials said that less dengue cases have been reported in many districts this time, and there has been a slight increase in cases in Greater Hyderabad. Less than 10 cases have been reported in 19 districts, while remaining districts reported 10 cases. Typhoid cases have also been reported very less compared to last year.

Damodar instructed the GHMC officials to appoint Special Officers for the GHMC zones where the severity of the diseases is high. The minister advised the Health Secretary to review with the Collectors on the control of seasonal diseases and focus more on tribal areas. The field medical staff should conduct a door-to-door survey and take steps to create awareness among the people.

The Minister also instructed the officials to be ready with all the necessary facilities in hospitals to provide treatment to patients affected by seasonal diseases. The Director of Public Health department was ordered to take strict action against private hospitals which are exploiting patients in the name of platelets treatment.

title: Chandigarh: Orange alert! Brace for heavy rain today, tomorrow - Hindustan Times
article_text:
Subscribe Now! Get features like
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has sounded an orange alert for Sunday and Monday amid a forecast for heavy rain on these days.
As per Met officials, the city is set to record anywhere between 15.6mm and 64.4 mm rain on these days.
IMD Chandigarh director Surinder Paul said, “There are chances of heavy rains at isolated places in the city on Sunday and Monday, and cloudy conditions through the week.”
The weatherman further said that this July, the city is set to experience more rain than what was recorded last year during this month. Last July, the city had recorded 224.5 mm rain. The average rain for the month is 273.2 mm.
This June, the city recorded 119.5 mm rain compared to 9.9 mm rain last year. The average rain for June is 155.5 mm.
Meanwhile, the temperatures dropped after Friday’s showers. The maximum temperature went from 34°C on Friday to 33.8°C on Saturday, 0.6°C below normal. The minimum temperature, however, climbed to 28.3°C on Saturday from 27.8°C the day before.
IMD has predicted rain till July 10 with the maximum temperature set to drop to 28°C and minimum around 25°C.

title: டெக்சாஸ் மாகாணத்தில் கனமழையால் ஏற்பட்ட வெள்ளத்தில் சிக்கி 32 பேர் உயிரிழப்பு! - Dinakaran
article_text:

அமெரிக்காவின் டெக்சாஸ் மாகாணத்தில் கனமழையால் ஏற்பட்ட வெள்ளத்தில் சிக்கி 32 பேர் உயிரிழந்துள்ளார். சான் ஆன்டோனியோவில் சுமார் 30 செ.மீ. அளவுக்கு கொட்டித் தீர்த்த கனமழையால் வெள்ளப்பெருக்கு ஏற்பட்டுள்ளது. டெக்சாஸ் மாகாணத்தில் ஏற்பட்ட வெள்ளப்பெருக்கில் 14 சிறார்கள் உட்பட 32 பேர் உயிரிழந்தனர்.
